sen.j: 福井端隠（ふくい たんいん、男性、享和元年9月1日 (旧暦)（1801年10月8日） - 明治18年（1885年）8月22日）は、幕末から明治の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Tanin FUKUI (male 8 October, 1801- 22 August 1885) is a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.
Tanin FUKUI (male 8 October, 1801- 22 August 1885) was a Japanese Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.
Tanin FUKUI (male 8 October, 1801- 22 August 1885) was a Japanese Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) from the end of Edo period to Meiji period.

sen.j: 名ははじめ武煕、福井氏を継承してから末影と改名。
sen.e: His name was Busho but changed it to Matsuei after succession to Fukui clan.
sen.cmt: 武煕→Busho (武煕) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］末影→Matsuei (末影)［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His name was Busho but changed it to Matsuei after succession to Fukui clan.
His name was Busho but changed it to Matsuei after succession to Fukui clan.

sen.j: 字は孔影、端隠は号 (称号)で他に凹隅・雨洗・緑雪書屋などがある。
sen.e: His Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Koei and Tanin is his Go (second name or alias), but, in addition to that, he has other Gos as Ogu, Usen, Ryokusetushooku.
sen.cmt: 凹隅→Ogu (凹隅) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］雨洗→Usen (雨洗) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］緑雪書屋→Ryokusetsushooku (緑雪書屋) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Koei and Tanin is his Go (second name or alias), but, in addition to that, he has other Gos as Ogu, Usen, Ryokusetushooku.

His Azana (courtesy name used by the scholars and the literati of Japan to lend an academic, cultured feel to the name) is Koei and Tanin is his Go (second name or alias), but, in addition to that, he has other Gos as Ogu, Usen, Ryokusetushooku.
His common name is Taito.
sen.cmt: 帯刀→Taito (帯刀) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His common name is Taito.
His common name is Taito.
He was born in Ise.
He was born in Ise.
He was born in Ise.
Brief Biography
Brief Biography
Brief Biography

sen.j: 榎倉勘解由武繁の次男として伊勢上中ノ郷（現在三重県伊勢市）に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born the second son of Enokurakageyushitakeshige in Isekaminakanogo (present-day Ise city, Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 榎倉勘解由武繁→Enokurakageyushitakeshige (榎倉勘解由武繁) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］伊勢上中ノ郷→Ise kaminakanogo ［地名の読みは日本歴史地名大系２４ 三重県の地名 平凡社 より判断しました］
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Takeshige ENOKURAKAGEYUSHI in Isekaminakanogo (present-day Ise city, Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: asを追加しました。Enokurakageyushitakeshige → Takeshige ENOKURAKAGEYUSHI
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Takeshige ENOKURAKAGEYUSHI in Isekaminakanogo (present-day Ise city, Mie Prefecture).

sen.j: 正四位下伊勢神宮神職職階に至った。
sen.e: He was ranked as Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in Shinto priesthood of Ise Jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 正四位下伊勢神宮神職職階→Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in Shinto priesthood of Ise Jingu Shrine ［定訳不明］
sen.e: He was ranked as Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in Shinto priesthood of Ise Jingu Shrine.
He was ranked as Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in Shinto priesthood of Ise Jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 下久保に住み、のちに為田に移った。
sen.e: He lived in Shimokubo and moved to Tameda.
sen.cmt: 下久保→Shimokubo (下久保) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］為田→Tameda (為田) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He lived in Shimokubo and moved to Tameda.
He lived in Shimokubo and moved to Tameda.

sen.j: 小俣蠖庵に就いて書画・篆刻を学ぶ。
sen.e: He studied calligraphic works and paintings and tenkoku under Kakuan OMATA.
sen.cmt: 小俣蠖庵→Kakuan OMATA (小俣蠖庵) ［Kotobank.jp http://kotobank.jp/］
sen.e: He studied calligraphic works and paintings and tenkoku under Kakuan OMATA.
He studied calligraphic works and paintings and tenkoku under Kakuan OMATA.

sen.j: 印聖高芙蓉の日本の篆刻史の篆刻を宗として一家を成し、大和古印体も得意とした。
sen.e: He established his own family, esteeming Japanese historical tenkoku created by Fuyo KO who is honored as insei (master of sealing), and he was also skillful at Yamatokointai.
sen.cmt: 大和古印体→Yamatokointai (大和古印体) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He established his own family, esteeming Japanese historical tenkoku created by Fuyo KO who is honored as insei (master of sealing), and he was also skillful at Yamatokointai.
He established his own family, esteeming Japanese historical tenkoku created by Fuyo KO who is honored as insei (master of sealing), and he was also skillful at Yamatokointai.

sen.j: また、茶道にも詳しく千宗室に入門した後、藪内紹智について藪内流を究めた。
sen.e: He was familiar with Sado (tea ceremony) and, after becoming a disciple of Soshitsu SEN, he mastered Yabunouchi school under Jyochi YABUNOUCHI.
sen.cmt: 藪内紹智→Jyochi YABUNOUCHI (藪内紹智) ［国立国会図書館蔵書検索システムNDL-OPAC http://opac.ndl.go.jp/］
sen.e: He was familiar with Sado (tea ceremony) and, after becoming a disciple of Soshitsu SEN, he mastered Yabunouchi school under Jyochi YABUNOUCHI.
He was familiar with Sado (tea ceremony) and, after becoming a disciple of Soshitsu SEN, he mastered Yabunouchi school under Jyochi YABUNOUCHI.

sen.j: 門弟に山田寒山・松木松年・山本釣青・上部紅於・田中成章・江川閑雲・田代閑松・桧垣梅坡・川崎渓雲・河村雨竹・北川橘園などがいる。
sen.e: Kanzan YAMADA, Shonen MATSUKI, Chosei YAMAMOTO, Koo UWABE, Seisho TANAKA, Kanun EGAWA, Kansho TASHIRO, Baiha HIGAKI, Keiun KAWASAKI, Uchiku KAWAMURA, Kitsuen KITAGAWA is disciples of him.
sen.cmt: 山本釣青・上部紅於・田中成章・江川閑雲・田代閑松・桧垣梅坡・川崎渓雲・河村雨竹・北川橘園→Chosei YAMAMOTO, Koo UWABE, Seisho TANAKA, Kanun EGAWA, Kansho TASHIRO, Baiha HＩGAKI, Keiun KAWASAKI, Uchiku KAWAMURA, Kitsuen KITAGAWA ［定訳不明：いずれの人名も該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: Kanzan YAMADA, Shonen MATSUKI, Chosei YAMAMOTO, Koo UWABE, Seisho TANAKA, Kanun EGAWA, Kansho TASHIRO, Baiha HIGAKI, Keiun KAWASAKI, Uchiku KAWAMURA, Kitsuen KITAGAWA are disciples of him.
Kanzan YAMADA, Shonen MATSUKI, Chosei YAMAMOTO, Koo UWABE, Seisho TANAKA, Kanun EGAWA, Kansho TASHIRO, Baiha HIGAKI, Keiun KAWASAKI, Uchiku KAWAMURA, Kitsuen KITAGAWA are disciples of him.
He died at 85.
He died at the age of 85.
sen.cmt: the age ofを追加しました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 85.

sen.j: 墓所は新町裏（現在伊賀市上野新町）になる。
sen.e: His graveyard was located in Shinmachiura (present-day Uenoshinmachi, Iga City).
sen.cmt: 新町裏→Shinmachiura (新町裏) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］伊賀市上野新町→Uenoshinmachi (伊賀市上野新町) ［日本郵政 http://www.post.japanpost.jp/
sen.e: His graveyard was located in Shinmachiura (present-day Uenoshinmachi, Iga City).
His graveyard was located in Shinmachiura (present-day Uenoshinmachi, Iga City).

sen.j: 子息の福井水琴も篆刻をよくしたが、若くして亡くなった。
sen.e: His son, Suikin FUKUI, has also remarkable skill of Tenkoku but he died at young age.
sen.cmt: 福井水琴→Suikin FUKUI (福井水琴) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His son, Suikin FUKUI, has also remarkable skill of Tenkoku but he died at young age.
His son, Suikin FUKUI, has also remarkable skill of Tenkoku but he died at young age.
